When you buy the parts yourself and then put everything together from scratch, it is a lot cheaper.

Lets see... Say you took plywood, steel cable (or some other strong flexible stuff), four motors, and some caster wheels. If you attach one cable to two motors as a pulley system and couple that to your simpit, you've got one axis of motion. Then couple the first pulley system to a second one perpendicular to it, and place the first on a caster wheel base, and presto, two axes.

EDIT: Disclaimer: I may have some experience in programming and mechanical engineering.
